page.title: 03 A DAY IN THE LIFE OF STUART
page.content: I live at Ellick Farm which is 4 miles from Tomintoul.I get up at 7 o'clock in the morning.On Fridays I get into school with Skene's buses who are based at the bottom of Tomintoul.On every other day I get into school with my mum.In winter we take the Land-Rover as the conditions are too bad for any car to get through.On our way to school in winter we have to battle through drifts of snow up to 3 feet high.In the summer of 1984 we were filmed by Thames Television for CBTV and during the winter CBTV showed the program nationwide to show the contrast between summer and winter.Our road is usually blocked as the snowploughs are too busy clearing the famous A939 Cockbridge to Tomintoul to clear our roads.Our road is rough for about 1 quarter of a mile and then it becomes a single-lane
